fields.description:
h2. Background
CSV export from Jira Server exports usernames of people associated with the issue. This leads to a problem for mapping users when importing users to Atlassian Cloud via CSV exports.

h2. Feature requested
* The CSV export from Jira Server should have the option to export users as their email address.
fields.summary: Option for CSV export in Jira Server to export email address as username identifier

fields.description: When the migration app (JCMA or CCMA) performs a migration, there's no progress indicator. Please provide this indicator and also a *command-line option* to monitor the migration progress.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to monitor the progress of a migration (using JCMA or CCMA)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Import is capable of adding new options to locked custom fields.
JIRA includes JIRA Importers Plugin (JIM). This is what provides the import functions seen in JIRA Administration "External System Import"
 * This includes options to import from CSV, JSON, FogBugz, Mantis, and others.
JIRA includes custom fields and the ability for custom fields to be "managed" or "locked." These are fields that are created by JIRA Applications or plugins. They are locked to prevent them from being changed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
*Example problem caused by this behaviour*

During import, the Epic Status custom field gets modified to include additional options. This causes JIRA Software boards to show epics that are marked as "Done"
 * See [Epics marked as Epic Status = Done continue to appear on the Agile Board |https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/epics-marked-as-epic-status-done-continue-to-appear-on-the-agile-board-779158631.html]for additional details regarding this behaviour.


*Reproduced in Jira Cloud*
 * Create CSV for importing, including Epic Status and at least one issue with Epic Status of "Open"
 * Import CSV through External System Import. On the field selection screen map the CSV Epic Status field to the Epic Status field in JIRA (do not map field value)
 * Observe that the new option has been added to the locked Epic Status custom field. This "Open" option causes the behaviour described in the KB article linked above.

h3. Expected Results

Locked fields cannot be modified by import. 
h3. Actual Results

Epic Status field updated with the new "Open" status.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available.

See similar ticket for Jira Server and Data Center - JRASERVER-67230
fields.summary: JIRA External System Import (JIM) can create new options for locked custom fields.

fields.description:
h3. Summary:
Currently when there are groups on Server that were deleted in past but still have references to projects, JCMA throws an error like below:
{code}2021-11-25 12:20:04.356 ERROR ABC project-export Group reference could not be found. Check if the group reference: "XYZ" exists.
{code}
Basically, it does not tell us where exactly in the project the group reference exists and the error is kind of misleading.


h3. Expectations:
We need improved logging with JCMA so that customer can self serve them seeing what and where exactly things are going wrong.

h3. Temporary workaround:
Create all such groups in Server so that there is no missing reference and perform the migration, you can delete them once the migration has been completed
fields.summary: JCMA does not provide detailed errors for missing group reference

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The copy from production to the sandbox environment is failing and causing an error.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Start a copy from production to a sandbox environment.


h3. Expected Results

Success during the copying.
h3. Actual Results
Failing during the copy.


h3. Workaround
In case of issues copying data from production to the sandbox, please open a support ticket.
fields.summary: Taskrecords is causing failure when copying data to a sandbox

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, there is no way to stop the reports (pre-migration & post-migration) generated by the JCMA. 
h3. Suggested Solution
 # Provide an option while choosing the migration plan to skip the report generation. 
 # Create a New Tab for Migration report on the Migration Wizard home page. 

h3. Why this is important
 * Report generations are Time consuming and resource-consuming activities, hence the ability to skip them should improve the time taken for the migration to complete and resource consumption on the Jira server for the migration.
 * Customers attempt multiple migration attempts and they don't need reports to be generated for all the attempts.
fields.summary: Need a option to Skip Migration report generation on JCMA

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After migration from server to cloud, the flag feature on the target Jira cloud site breaks. 
Flagging an issue fails with the following error:

{quote}We couldn't flag this issue
Check your connection and try adding the flag again{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Verify that the Flagged custom field is either locked or only configured with a single custom field context.
# Migrate data from server to cloud via the migration assistant.
# Verify the Flag custom field again and try to flag an issue.

h3. Expected Results

- The Flagged custom field should remain either locked or configured with a single custom field context. The migrated data should start using the option that is provided by locked field. 
- Flagging works

h3. Actual Results

- The Flagged custom field has been unlocked and a second custom field context has been uploaded. 

 !custom field.png|thumbnail! 

- Flagging of issues is not working. 

 !flag.png|thumbnail! 
 !flag error.png|thumbnail! 



h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Flagging feature breaks after migration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently, when using JCMA to migrate a JSW project to the cloud the JQL board filter using project id gets broken showing this error message on the filter query:
{code}A value with ID 'XXX' does not exist for the field 'project'.{code}


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Scrum project.
 # Go to Backlog -> Board -> Configure.
 # Change the default filter value from "Project Key" to the "[Project id|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-get-project-id-from-the-jira-user-interface-827341414.html]".
# Check that the filter continues to function normally.
# Migrate this project via JCMA.
# On the Board filter query setting in Jira Cloud you will find the error: 
{code}A value with ID '10100' does not exist for the field 'project'.{code}

h3. Expected Results
The expected behavior here should be this JQL board filter using "project id" still works when migrated to the cloud.

h3. Actual Results 
"Backlog" and "Active Sprints" show no results after migrating and checking the JQL board filter associated we can see the error message, as explained before.

This happens because the "project id" in the cloud database is different from the original one. On this lab test the original value was "10100" and after migrating the same has changed to "13700".

h3. Workarounds
 # Change the "project id" to the "project key" on the Jira Server filters before migrating.
 # Change the "project id" to the "project key" on the Jira Cloud filters as a post-migration step.
 # Change the "project id" to reflect the newer "project id" on the Jira Cloud. The same can be found on [Project Settings -> Details|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-get-project-id-from-the-jira-user-interface-827341414.html].
fields.summary: JQL board filter using project id doesn’t bring expected results after migrating via JCMA

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When migrating with Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant, app users are not added to the Space so apps are unable to make REST calls via Connect to access content. App users are added to the default groups, but these groups might not be added to the Space post-migration.

This is caused by the app not having permission in the Space post-migration. This is similar to MIG-303, however that relates to Custom Content and Restricted Pages.

Each app in Confluence Cloud has a dedicated user. After installing an app in Cloud, you can see the app user by going to a Space -> Space Settings -> Space Permissions, and under *Individual Users* you will see a user for each installed app. This user is also added to the default group, but this is not visible in the UI.

On migrated Spaces, the app user does not appear under {*}Individual Users{*}. Also, the Space does not have a default group applied.

This is the *Individual Users* of a Space migrated with CCMA

!image-2021-12-14-16-52-07-330.png|thumbnail!

This is the *Individual Users* of a Space created in Cloud, you can see the app user *com-atlassian-devhelp-jrichards* has been added automatically.

!image-2021-12-14-16-54-08-711.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Provision a new Cloud site
 # Create a new Space in server with default permissions, and create a page in the space
 # Migrate the Space to the new Cloud site
 # For a Connect app with Scope READ, access the REST endpoint

{{GET /wiki/rest/api/content/<id>}}

authenticated as the add on for any content id that was in the migration.
h3. Expected Results

The content is returned in a JSON blob
{code:json}
{"id":"6160385","type":"page","status":"current","title":"Test page", ...{code}
h3. Actual Results

A HTTP 403 is returned
{noformat}
403 Forbidden: [{"statusCode":403,"data":{"authorized":false,"valid":false,"errors":[{"message":{"key":"confluence.space.restricted","translation":"Space is restricted","args":[]}}],"successful":false},"message":"com.atlassian.confluence.api.service.exceptions.PermissionException: Space is restricted"}]{noformat}
h3. Workaround

After the Space is migrated, uninstall and re-install the app. Access the same REST endpoints for the same {{{}contentIds{}}}. The content should return as expected.

Another workaround is to add the app user to as an Individual user to the Space. This is the same as Spaces created in Cloud.
fields.summary: App user is not added to Space when Migrating content with CCMA

fields.description:
*Summary*

When migrating from a server to the cloud and using a site XML backup to import data, customers can use JCMA to migrate all of their users and groups.

Users who may have multiple directories connected to their local instances may encounter users who have the same username but a different email address.

When users are in this configuration, it can cause some problems for the site import because users with duplicate usernames will not be able to go through the sync pass of this import method. It would be helpful if JCMA could do this check as well.

*Current functionality*

JCMA only marks users of the following configuration as duplicates:

 
||Username||Email address||
|username1 |email@domain.com|
|username1 |email@domain.com|

 

*Desired functionality*

 

For site import migrations, it would be helpful if JCMA could also mark the configuration below as duplicate so that customers can check ahead of time what type of user consolidation they need to do before actually importing the data:

 
||Username||Email address||
|username1 |email@domain.com|
|username1 |email2@domain.com|

*Additional details*

Having this additional functionality would be helpful as clients can consolidate users at the database / AD level instead of relying on various methods to bulk data into XML files.
It would be helpful to provide a mechanism in the JCMA UI to enable / disable this mechanism when importing a site after migrating users and groups.
fields.summary: Allow the JCMA to validate if users with the same username and different email addresses exist on the database

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

CSV importer doesn't import *Select List (cascading)* field data correctly.
This problem happens only when we use {{Issues}} > {{Import Issues from CSV}} on the top page.
This problem never happens when we import CSV using {{System}} > {{External System Import}} in the Administration page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project
 # Add *Select List (cascading)* custom field and set their options
 # Associate the custom field to the project you created on step1
 # Import CSV from {{Issues}} > {{Import Issues from CSV}}

h3. Expected Results

The CSV data should be imported to JIRA correctly.
h3. Actual Results

*Select List (cascading)* custom field data (especially the child option) was not imported. 
See the screenshot attached: [^Select List (cascading) CSV import failed.png]
h3. Workaround

Use {{System}} > {{External System Import}} in Administration page instead.
fields.summary: CSV importer doesn't import "Select List (cascading)" field data correctly.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira imports from Trello boards no longer work. That seems to be because of a change in Trello security policies that were announced two months ago:

https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/pure-wildcard-allowed-origins-on-app-keys-will-no-longer-be-recognized-and-will-be-fully-deprecated/52093
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Jira's External System Import
 # Select Trello and follow the steps

h3. Expected Results

The Trello board and cards are imported to a Jira project
h3. Actual Results

Error message:
{noformat}
Invalid return_url. Wildcard ("*") allowed origins are no longer supported. Contact the developer. See https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/52093 {noformat}
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround, the External System Importer must be fixed
fields.summary: Error using the Jira External System Importer on Trello boards

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While migrating Jira Service Management project, some Request Types fail to export because of dependence on certain issue statuses.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Jira Administration -> Issues -> Statuses. Create a new Issue Status, say "Dismissed".
 # Select any workflow that is used in the project. Edit it such that it now includes the newly created status "Dismissed"
 # Go to Project Settings -> Request Types. Select "Edit Fields" for any request type that uses the workflow that was modified in step 2. 
 # Under the workflow statuses tab, set a custom status name for the new status.
 # Remove the status from the workflow. (Optionally, delete the status)
 # Migrate the project.

h3. Expected Results

The project should be migrated successfully. The request type does not contain custom workflow status name for the deleted status. 
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the export error logs file:
{noformat}
2021-10-31 17:23:01.391 ERROR PROJ project-export We couldn't export Request Type 10. Reason: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Entity mri:mig:jira/classic:issueStatus:11020 is expected to be exported, but it was not. {noformat}
h3. Workaround

Remove the custom status mappings for the request types.

For each instance of the above error:
 # Get the request type id (say X) and the issue status ID (say Y) from the log statement. In the above example, X = 10 and Y = 11020
 # Execute the following SQL query (written for PostgreSQL - modify as required):
{noformat}
DELETE FROM "AO_54307E_STATUSMAPPING" WHERE "STATUS_ID"='Y' AND "FORM_ID"=X;
{noformat}
fields.summary: Jira Service Management Request Type Export Failure - IssueStatus expected to be exported

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

This export error could happen in the following scenarios :
 # *Scenario #1:* Approval has reference to "Issue Status" that was deleted from Workflow however it still exists in the DB and Approval is not stale.
 # *Scenario #2:* Approval has reference to "Issue Status" that was deleted from Workflow and it doesn't exist in the Database

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create new Status “New Status”
 # Create new Request type with Issue Type - Service Request with Approvals
 # Go to Service Request with Approvals Workflow
 # Add new status and choose “New Status”
 # Add new transition from from “Waiting For Approval” → “New Status”
 # Add two new transitions from “New Status” for approved and declined scenarios
 # Configure “New Status” → Add approval → Configure transitions
 # Raise a request and make two approves
 # Make sure that Approval is saved in DB with “New Status” reference
 # Delete “New Status” from workflow
 # Try to export or migrate project

h3. Expected Results

*Scenario #1:* Migrate Approvals successfully.

{*}Scenario #2{*}: We should migrate only those approvals that have references to existing / value Issue statuses in DB (NOTE: This decision is still under discussion and isn't final)

 
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the JCMA error log file
{noformat}
2021-XX-XX XX:XX:48.724 ERROR XXXXX project-export Approval with MRI - mri:mig:jira/classic:issueStatus:1234 has missing Issue status with id - 12345. Verify if Issue status with id 12345 is valid. {noformat}
h3. Workaround

*Scenario #1:*

If "Issue Status" exists in the database, then client should add this dark FF in server `com.atlassian.jira.migration.status-pruning-disable.feature.enabled` . So, issue statuses will be exported as global entities.

*Scenario #2:*

If "Issue Status" does not exist in database, but its references are present then we need to remove such references. The reference could exist in multiple places such as
 # Workflow descriptor XML
 # Approval table

Appropriate SQL queries need to be executed to remove invalid Issue status references from the server database.

*NOTE:* The next version of JCMA which is marked for release mid December will contain a fix such that the above mentioned workarounds aren't required.
fields.summary: Approval fails to export with error - Verify if Issue status with id xxxx is valid.

fields.description:

While migrating JSM projects from server to cloud via JSM-JCMA plugin, certain SLA / Time metric entities will fail while being imported in cloud. This occurs because the logic to identify the latest Goal during import is ambiguous. (i.e. at times it identifies a certain goal to be the default one incorrectly)
h3. Steps to Reproduce

_to be added..._
h3. Expected Results

Time metric should be imported successfully
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the JCMA error log file
{noformat}
2021-XX-XX XX:XX:51.040 ERROR XXXX project-import We couldn't import Time Metric 1234. Reason: 400 Bad Request: [{"indexToRestErrorResponse":{"0":{"errors":[],"reasonKey":"sd.sla.configuration.metric.goal.default.wrong.position","reasonCode":"400"}}}]. This caused 77758 other items to fail. {noformat}
h3. Workaround

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While migrating Jira Service Management project, some SLAs (time metric) fail to export because of dependence on invalid issue statuses.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Jira Administration -> Issues -> Statuses. Create a new Issue Status, say "Dismissed".
 # Select any workflow that is used in the project. Edit it such that it now includes the newly created status "Dismissed"
 # Go to Project Settings -> SLAs. Create a new SLA such that one of the Start/Stop/Pause conditions have the "Dismissed" status selected. Save the SLA. 
 # Edit the workflow (the one modified in step 2) such that it does not contain the "Dismissed" status anymore. 
 # Go to Jira Administration -> Issues -> Statuses. Delete the status "Dismissed"
 # Migrate the project.

h3. Expected Results

The project should be migrated successfully. The migrated SLA does not refer to the deleted status.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the export error logs file:
{noformat}
2021-10-27 12:43:58.592 ERROR PROJ project-export We couldn't export Time Metric 12. Reason: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Entity mri:mig:jira/classic:issueStatus:10017 is expected to be exported, but it was not. {noformat}
h3. Verify the issue

The following SQL query (written for PostgreSQL) should ideally return an empty response. If the query returns one or more IDs, each ID represents a reference to an invalid status. 
{noformat}
SELECT "CONDITION_ID"
FROM "AO_54307E_METRICCONDITION"
WHERE "FACTORY_KEY" = 'status-sla-condition-factory'
AND "CONDITION_ID" NOT IN (SELECT ID FROM issuestatus);
{noformat}
(The query returns the IDs of those statuses that are referred to in SLAs but are not found in the status table (do not exist - likely because they were deleted)).
h3. Workaround

NOTE: It is recommended to create a backup your server before executing the workarounds. 
h4. Workaround 1 (Using UI - recommended)
 # Open project settings for the particular project.
 # Go to SLAs. 
 # Select each SLA one-by-one. If the SLA contains invalid status reference, an error message should be displayed similar to attached image {{1.png}}
 # Edit the SLA. Remove the problematic statuses from the conditions and save the SLA. ({{{}2.png{}}})
 # Once all SLAs are fixed, click the {{update}} link below the SLA menu (shown in image {{3.png).}}
 # Attempt to migrate the project again.

h4. Workaround 2 (Using DB) 
 # Remove the references to invalid statuses using the following query. Note: This query will also remove similar invalid status references in SLAs across all project. 

{noformat}
DELETE FROM "AO_54307E_METRICCONDITION"
WHERE "FACTORY_KEY" = 'status-sla-condition-factory'
AND "CONDITION_ID" NOT IN (SELECT ID FROM issuestatus){noformat}
       2. Attempt to migrate the project again.
fields.summary: Jira Service Management Time Metric Export Failure - "We couldn't export Time Metric"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary:
Currently, when migrating attachments only via JCMA, it still shows the issue count in the configuration screen.
Also, on the migration screen, it shows project data as *None* but it would be good to have it more obvious that it is an attachment-only migration or just remove the issue count under the Projects section in the Configuration screen.
The issue count in the configuration screen and not very accurate UI for attachments only migration makes it a kind misleading.
fields.summary: Attachments only migration UI is misleading in JCMA

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Migrating space with 'Migrate users related to the spaces you select to migrate' also check users unrelated to space having duplicate and invalid email address and fails at pre-flight check
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # User CCMA 3.2.7
 # Create a space S with user A
 # Create user B and user C with invalid and same email address
 # Migrate space S with the option 'Migrate users related to the spaces you select to migrate'
 # CCMA will fail at pre-flight check with invalid and duplicate users B and C

h3. Expected Results

As users B and C are unrelated to Space S, they should not be scanned during the pre-flight check.
h3. Actual Results

Migration fails at pre-flight check reporting invalid and duplicate users which are not related to Space being migrated
h3. Workaround

The current workaround is to use an older version of CCMA by using the dark feature.
 #  Uninstall the current version of CCMA and install 3.2.3 from the following page:
[CCMA All Version|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1219672/confluence-cloud-migration-assistant/version-history]
 # Enable the following dark features on the confluence serve, refer to [How to add dark-features-in-confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/dark-features-in-confluence-1079350770.html?preview=%2F1079350770%2F1079350773%2FScreenshot+2021-08-14+at+4.21.57+PM.png#:~:text=Dark%20Features%20in%20Confluence]:
{code:java}
migration-assistant.disable.app-outdated-check{code}
h4.
fields.summary: CCMA 3.2.7 - migrating users related to space erroneously checks users not related to space with duplicate and invalid emails

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Comments imported to existing issues via CSV are added as *internal* if the author is a customer and *public* if the author is an agent.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue in a service project
 # Create a CSV file with comments (including 'Issue key', 'Summary', and 'Comment' columns)
 # Go to *Settings* > *System* > *External System Import* and import the file
 # Map the CSV columns with the 'Issue key', 'Summary', and 'Comment body' fields, respectively, and finish the import

{panel}
(!) Note the warning message that is displayed in the last step of the import process:



"*All internal comments will become public* - All the comments from your import file will become public after the CSV import"
{panel}
h3. Expected Results

All comments are converted to *public*.
h3. Actual Results

Only the comments that the author is an agent become public. If the comment author is a customer account (or Aa without a license), the comment will become internal.
h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Comments imported via CSV become internal if author is a customer

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

We have noticed an issue with User Migration with CCMA 3.2.7 version. After the Migration with CCMA, all the users are shown as “{*}Former user (deleted){*}” on confluence cloud UI.
h3. _This can happen to any CCMA version above 3.2.3 using_ Confluence server version 5.10 -> 6.13
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Do a simple confluence migration with CCMA v3.2.7 from Confluence server version 5.10 -> 6.13. The users will be migrated with *Former User (Deleted)* instead of original user names.

There are currently at least 10 tickets with similar symptoms. 

*This has not been fixed.*
h3. Expected Results

After Migration, all users should be migrated with correct names.

Server screenshot:
!image-2021-11-15-11-42-10-475.png|width=1215,height=357!
h3. Actual Results

After the Migration with CCMA, all the users are shown as “{*}Former user (deleted){*}”.

!image-2021-11-15-11-42-42-120.png|width=1034,height=564!
h3. Workaround

The current workaround is to use an older version of CCMA by using the dark feature.
 #  Uninstall the current version of CCMA and install 3.2.3 from the following page:
[CCMA All Version|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1219672/confluence-cloud-migration-assistant/version-history]
 # Enable the following dark features on the confluence server:
{code:java}
migration-assistant.disable.app-outdated-check{code}
fields.summary: In CCMA, users are getting Migrated as “Former user (deleted)”

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When performing a Jira site import into the Cloud, you may see this error, especially if you are importing a large dataset (50Gb of XML).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Jira backup
# Import it on the Cloud

h3. Expected Results

Validation goes through successfully.

h3. Actual Results

The following error message appears in the UI.

 !7381553f-e44d-4f35-8a8f-5f0e4a493532.png|thumbnail! 

{code:java}
Import error
There was an error importing file jira-cloud.zip: Unknown error occurred during import validation (timeout).. Please try again or choose a different file.
{code}

h3. Workaround

This is an intermittent error, and retrying should get it through.

_Note:_ This is more prominent in large backup files.
fields.summary: Jira site import fails during validation

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there is no way to review the users/groups that will be migrated to Cloud on CCMA. This makes the admins difficult to understand who is migrating to Cloud.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide pre-migration report and post migration report like JCMA.

h3. Why this is important
* Understand is there any missed users/groups from the migration, especially when we use scoped users and groups option.
* Understand is there any unwanted users being migrated.
fields.summary: Report feature on CCMA

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JCMA fails to migrate boards owned by users that don't have permission to browse the project being migrated. The error is misleading as it will indicate that boards is a Cross-project boards

JCMA pre-migration summary logs show:

{quote}
Cross-project board Boards that reference multiple projects are not supported via migration. This board will not be migrated.   If you require this board, re-create the board in your cloud site. To pull out the JQL for board filters, run SQL queries from this page: https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/troubleshooting-errors-and-non-migrated-entities-with-the-jira-cloud-migration-assistant-1021239878.html
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a single project board be owned by a user with no 'Browse Project' permissions for the project associated with the board
 # Migrate the project that contains the board using JCMA

h3. Expected Results

JCMA should migrate that project and board

h3. Actual Results

JCMA finishes, but board will not be migrated and listed as a 'Cross-project' board in pre-migration logs

h3. Workaround

Make sure to board owner has permissions to browse project associated with board
fields.summary: JCMA fails to migrate boards owned by users that don't have 'Browse Project' permissions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Updating the issue type for a subtask through CSV import doesn't remove the parent relation


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a story and a subtask under it
 # Create a CSV file to update the issue type of Subtask to Story/Task
 # Update the issue type through CSV import


h3. Expected Results
Parent-child related of the updated issue will be removed

h3. Actual Results
Parent-child relation is retained and the updated issue will be listed under the Subtasks.


h3. Workaround

# Convert the issue type of the updated issue to a Subtask using the Convert to subtask option or bulk edit.
# Change the issue type back to the required Story issue type
fields.summary: Updating the issue type for a subtask through CSV import doesn't remove the parent relation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While migrating Jira Service Management project, certain comments will fail to export if the project lead of the project doesn't have sufficient permission to access the respective project data (in this case comments or queues)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create Jira Service Management (JSM) project
 # Ensure project lead doesn't have `Browse Project` and/or `Servicedesk Agent` permission for the project being migrated
 # Migrate respective JSM project via JSM-JCMA (Jira Cloud Migration Assistant) plugin

h3. Expected Results

Comments should be exported. The project lead need not have the "Browse Project" or "Servicedesk Agent"  permission.
h3. Actual Results - Comments fails to export

The below exception is thrown in the JCMA error log file:
{noformat}
20XX-XX-XX Xx:XX:12.565 ERROR XXXX project-export Failed to retrieve JSM Comment for comment 123456.{noformat}
Jira application log will contain the following message
{code:java}
20XX-XX-01 Xx:XX:56,432+0000 pool-XX-thread-XX ERROR XXXX-XXX .. /rest/migration/latest/plan/save-and-start ... Couldn't fetch SDComment for commentId [1234] in issueId [1234]
com.atlassian.servicedesk.api.ForbiddenException: You do not have permission to view this comment
...{code}
h3. Actual Results - Queues fails to export

The below exception is thrown in the JCMA error log file:
{noformat}
20XX-XX-02 XX:XX:30.931 ERROR XX project-export Failed to retrieve queues.
{noformat}
Jira application log will contains the following message
{code:java}
2021-XX-XX XX:XX:44,... ERROR prae-admin ... /rest/plugins/1.0/ ... Couldn't fetch some queues for servicedesk [1234]
com.atlassian.servicedesk.api.ForbiddenException: You don't have permission to access this Service Desk.
...{code}
h3. Workaround
 # Assign `Browse Project` and `Servicedesk Agent` permissions to the project lead of the project/s being migrated.
 # Ensure that the project lead is a Jira user and also has application access to Jira Service Management. 
 # Re-migrate with JSM-JCMA plugin
fields.summary: Jira Service Management (JSM) comment export failure - Failed to retrieve JSM Comment / queues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Advanced Roadmaps JCMA doesn't migrate Parent Link data properly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use non-EAP JCMA to migrate Software data to the Cloud.
# Install JCMA Advanced Roadmaps EAP.
# Migrate all Advanced Roadmaps plus an empty project (built just so one could migrate Advanced Roadmaps)

h3. Expected Results
Migration goes through with all data moved over to Cloud.

h3. Actual Results
First, it can fail because of the following error:
{code}
2021-11-01 12:25:37.132 ERROR BLAH project-import We couldn't import Custom Field 'Feature'. Reason: You cannot create a new field of type 'Parent Link' as it is locked.. This caused 2 other items to fail.
{code}

When *Parent Link* field is unlocked with [this workaround|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/unlock-a-locked-jira-software-custom-field-779158866.html], migration goes through, however, *Parent Link* field loses value for issues/screens it was assigned to.

h3. Potential Workaround
Only workaround is to try using the EAP to migrate *all* instance data in a single batch (Advanced Roadmaps + Jira), however, that can fail with the following error:
{code}
2021-11-01 12:25:37.132 ERROR BLAH project-import We couldn't import Workflow Scheme 'BLAH BLAH Workflow'. Reason: IllegalStateException: Duplicate key BLAH BLAH Workflow. This caused 34591 other items to fail.
{code}

Interesting to note that one could create a new plan and re-migrate each of the failed projects. This would move them correctly to Cloud, but would cause duplicated workflows with the _*(migrated)*_ tag on it. If one's willing to do data clean-up post-migration, this can be a potential workaround.
fields.summary: AR JCMA doesn't import Parent Link data

fields.description:
Customer tries to migrate a Roadmap Issue Source which is *filter-based*, but it fails with the following error:

{noformat}
2021-10-28 15:37:13,585+0000 pool-59-thread-7 ERROR user.test 8x120x5 blah 1.1.1.90 /rest/plugins/1.0/available/featured [c.a.j.m.export.framework.DefaultExportFailureHandler] zzzzzzz-aaaaa-2222-3333-blahlbalh: Exporting entity Plan 11 failed
com.atlassian.jira.migration.export.framework.ExportException: Plan 11 issue source with value 12345 has no valid type.
at com.atlassian.jira.migration.export.advancedroadmaps.PlanExporter.invalidSourceTypeError(PlanExporter.kt:210)
at com.atlassian.jira.migration.export.advancedroadmaps.PlanExporter.mapIssueSources(PlanExporter.kt:185)
at com.atlassian.jira.migration.export.advancedroadmaps.PlanExporter.exportData(PlanExporter.kt:114)
at com.atlassian.jira.migration.export.advancedroadmaps.PlanExporter.exportData(PlanExporter.kt:59)
{noformat}

h2. Root Cause
This happens because JCMA Advanced Roadmaps EAP doesn't support *filter-based* Issue Sources.

h2. Possible Workaround:
The possible workaround is to change configuration of the plan(s) that uses filter as an issues source. Since filters are migrated separately, there shouldn't be problems to switch issue source to board/project on the server side and back to filter on the cloud side after the migration.
fields.summary: AR JCMA should migrate filter based plans

h3. Issue Summary
Site import is failing with "BatchUpdateException for insert into cwd_membership" when users from an external directory are present on the source instance.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Migrate all users and groups using the JCMA
 # Perform the required pre-checks on the XML
 # If the XML file has external directory references, inform the Migration Support team so that they can make a modification on the backend to allow the import to happen
 # Import the backup selecting the option "I've migrated user data using the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant"

h3. Expected Results
The import will go through without any issues.

h3. Actual Results
On the UI we're seeing the following error message:
{code}Error importing data: cloud.atlassian.logmon.laas.api.PrivacySafeException: Privacy-safe boxing of a com.atlassian.crowd.exception.runtime.OperationFailedException{code}

On the cloud logs, we can see the following stack:
{code}com.querydsl.core.QueryException: Caught BatchUpdateException for insert into "public"."cwd_membership" ("child_id", "child_name", "lower_child_name", "directory_id", "parent_id", "parent_name", "lower_parent_name", "membership_type", "group_external_id")
values ((select "CWD_USER"."id"
from "public"."cwd_user" "CWD_USER"
where "CWD_USER"."external_id" = ?), (select "CWD_USER"."user_name"
from "public"."cwd_user" "CWD_USER"
where "CWD_USER"."external_id" = ?), (select "CWD_USER"."lower_user_name"
from "public"."cwd_user" "CWD_USER"
where "CWD_USER"."external_id" = ?), ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?)
ON CONFLICT ("parent_id", "child_id", "membership_type") DO UPDATE SET "child_name" = "excluded"."child_name", "lower_child_name" = "excluded"."lower_child_name", "directory_id" = "excluded"."directory_id", "parent_name" = "excluded"."parent_name", "lower_parent_name" = "excluded"."lower_parent_name", "group_external_id" = "excluded"."group_external_id"{code}

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When trying to perform csv import with large data set cause the error *jira.importer.plugin.csv.field.mapping.page.too.many.mappings.values*

*!Capture 2016-09-04 at 14.23.41.png|thumbnail!*

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Import the attached *Mock_DataNew.csv* with the option *Map field value* option.
# The error will be reproduce when you try to import.

h3. Expected result

Import is successful with no error.

h3. Actual result

The import failed with the error *jira.importer.plugin.csv.field.mapping.page.too.many.mappings.values*

Reduce the amount of data (rows).

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
External system import service might create duplicated issues because the thread drop the task in the middle and start to import issues again

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create a CSV
 # import the CSV into Jira

h3. Expected Results
the issues should be created without any errors

h3. Actual Results
the thread drop the task in the middle and start to importing again, leading to duplicated tickets



h3. Workaround

It's better reduce the size of CSV file used for importing. This reduces the import time. Hence the import getting stopped due to node shutting down will be reduced. Also perform the import during off-business hours to increase the chances of success. Note that off-business hours in a shared infrastructure would mean off business for the entire region and not just the instance.
fields.summary: External system import service might create duplicated issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

This can occur is JSW isn't present in the server instance

Root cause of this error was with {{RapidView}} and {{Sprint}} classes used in {{EntityIdentifierGenerator}} . This classes is from {{greenhopper}} api which is JSW dependency. As this dependency have provided scope , JCMA expected that it would be provided by Jira Server, but if JSW not installed in the Server it wouldn’t find this classes.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

You need Jira Server or Jira Data Center instance with Jira Core and JSM only, without JSW. Make sure you don’t have {{greenhopper}} OSGI bundle in your server via this endpoint - {{/plugins/servlet/upm/osgi}} Run the migration. This error will be reproduced every time if migration will failed and error log will be generated
h3. Expected Results

JCMA shouldn't throw an error and should avoiding loading JSW specific classless when JSW is not present in server instance.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown is observed in Jira application log file
{noformat}
2021-XX-XX XX:XX:12,430+0000 pool-9482-thread-17 WARN anonymous     [c.a.j.migration.log.MigrationLogsService] Error executing download for import logs java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/atlassian/greenhopper/model/rapid/RapidView
at com.atlassian.jira.migration.log.EntityIdentifierGenerator.determineIdentifier(EntityIdentifierGenerator.kt:98)
at com.atlassian.jira.migration.log.EntityIdentifierGenerator.generate(EntityIdentifierGenerator.kt:55)
at com.atlassian.jira.migration.log.EntityIdentifierGenerator.generate(EntityIdentifierGenerator.kt:51)
...{noformat}
h3. Workaround

This has been fixed and will be released in the next JSM-JCMA plugin

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In a Jira cloud site, consider a case where backups are triggered through an Automation Rule.

The expectation is that in the `Backup Manager` page, the progress of the operation is shown and once it completes, the downloadable link to the backup made available.

This behavior was found to be inconsistent, wherein only the User through whom the Backup was fired was able to see the progress and download link, but not the other users on site, including the other site admins.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create automation rule for taking backups (through web request).
 # Fire a backup manually through the automation rule.
 # See if different users are able to view the progress and download link on "Backup Manager" page.

h3. Expected Results

Users should be able to view the progress of backup as well as download link, once backup finishes.
h3. Actual Results

Only the user whose Auth token was used in defining the backup web request will be able to view the results.
h3. Workaround

If it helps the customer, they can change the token in the automation rule's web request to that of the user who wishes to view the progress and/or download the zip file at the end.
fields.summary: Backups triggered through Jira Automation Rule not showing Download link at the end of it

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, JCMA does not support the migration of projects which are already present on the Cloud side, we first need to delete them and then migrate the projects again after a successful test migration.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be helpful if we can have a differential migration feature in JCMA. Have a migration saved in the source system, then click a button and the JCMA would take the projects/issues diffs, find the corresponding in the target system, and just apply the changes. This helps because oftentimes, users keep working in the source systems even as we do the initial migration and it would save time instead of remigrating everything again to the cloud destination.
fields.summary: JCMA to support incremental migration

Since the user has the *Make bulk changes* permission, and they are able to see the option to import, the basic users should be able to do the importing and mapping Issue.

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.

fields.description:
h3. Issue
 * The customer is using the "Migrate users related to the selected spaces" option in Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant
 * We observe that All the users are Migrated
 * Also the users are getting added to the confluence-users group. The migrated users have both site and product access.

h3. Steps to replicate :
 * Create few users in your confluence server.
 * Create one space and add few pages using the users added in step#1
 * Update to the latest version of Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant (3.2.6).
 * Create a migration plan and ensure to select the "Migrate users related to the selected spaces" option is selected and chose the space you created in step #2.
 * Create and run the migration.
 * We observe that All the users are Migrated

*Expected Results:*
 Only users part of the Space should be Migrated

When you select Only users related to the selected spaces under users and groups, We will only migrate this information for users directly connected to the spaces you are migrating. We will not give these users product access or add them to any groups. They will appear in your cloud site user list.

*Actual results:*
 All the users are Migrated.
 They are also added to the confluence-users group with the site and product access.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

We can't communicate with your server error on CCMA version 3.2.6. Issue has been reproduced when connecting to an Oracle database
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create migration on CCMA 3.2.6
 * Save and run

h3. Expected Results
 * Migration runs

h3. Actual Results
 * Page refreshes and migration cannot start

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-confluence.log file:
{noformat}
java.sql.SQLRecoverableException: Closed Connection
{noformat}
h3. Workaround
 * Downgrade CCMA to previous version.
 * Uninstall Confluence Migration Assistant 3.2.6 and upload version 3.2.5
 * Old version of Confluence Migration Assistant can be found here:
[https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1219672/confluence-cloud-migration-assistant/version-history]
 * In Confluence server, go to ${CONFLUENCE_URL}/admin/darkfeatures.action
 * Add the following feature:
 ** *migration-assistant.disable.app-outdated-check*
 * Clear your cache if needed and then try running the migration again.

h3. Notes

After setting up Confluence 7.13.1 with Oracle 12c R2, the issue could not be replicated. It's possible this is caused by a database configuration issue or another performance issue.
fields.summary: We can't communicate with your server error on latest CCMA version

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While using the JSM-JCMA plugin to migrate a JSM project, Servicedesk export currently fails while exporting LingoTranslation with logicalIds of certain forms(example: `sd.portal.name.1`).

The failure occurs while trying to export invalid logicalId to cloud, since the pattern for logical Id (prefixed by 'sd' )belongs to cloud. And on the server, the logicId has prefix 'jsds' instead of 'sd'. 

This might happen when a customer tries a "cloud -> server -> cloud" type of migration.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

To be documented.
h3. Expected Results

If Lingo translation are invalid then provide better error messaging else Servicedesk should be migrated.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the JCMA error log file:
{code:java}
2021-XX-XX XX:06:03.115 ERROR XX project-export We couldn't export Servicedesk 1. Reason: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: true.{code}
 

Stack trace observed in atlassian-jira.log
{code:java}
...
2021-XX-XX XXX:15:09,449+0530 pool-83-thread-6 ERROR admin 871x163x1 11x492z 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [c.a.j.m.export.framework.DefaultExportFailureHandler] 3XXX6f1-XX6f-4af0-9351-2b0XXd5: Exporting referenced entities by Servicedesk 1 failed
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: true
	at com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkArgument(Preconditions.java:141)
	at com.atlassian.jira.migration.export.db.servicedesk.lingo.LingoTranslationReader$Companion.validateLogicalIdFields(LingoTranslationReader.kt:204)
	at com.atlassian.jira.migration.export.db.servicedesk.lingo.LingoTranslationReader$Companion.getLogicalId(LingoTranslationReader.kt:189)
	at com.atlassian.jira.migration.export.db.servicedesk.lingo.LingoTranslationReader$Companion.access$getLogicalId(LingoTranslationReader.kt:166)
	at com.atlassian.jira.migration.export.db.servicedesk.lingo.LingoTranslationReader.readLingoTranslationForProject$lambda-1(LingoTranslationReader.kt:95)
...
{code}
 
h3. Workaround

Since the string format for logicalId belong to cloud, and JCMA treats it as an invalid reference. As a workaround for this particular case, we can try to not include the lingo translations while performing the migration and can create them manually on the cloud after the migration.

To do so, we can delete all the translation. 

[NOTE: These commands will delete the data from DB and it would be gone from server. It is recommended that you take a backup of the translations to help restoring data to the cloud manually]
{code:java}
delete from AO_C7F17E_LINGO_TRANSLATION where ID in (
Select table1.ID ​
FROM AO_C7F17E_LINGO_TRANSLATION as table1
INNER JOIN AO_C7F17E_LINGO_REVISION as table2
ON table1.LINGO_REVISION_ID  = table2.ID
inner join AO_C7F17E_LINGO as table3
on table2.LINGO_ID = table3.ID
where table3.PROJECT_ID=<PROJECT_ID> and  table3.LOGICAL_ID like '%sd.%');

delete from AO_C7F17E_LINGO_REVISION where ID in (
Select table2.ID 
​FROM AO_C7F17E_LINGO_REVISION as table2
ON table1.LINGO_REVISION_ID  = table2.ID
inner join AO_C7F17E_LINGO as table3
on table2.LINGO_ID = table3.ID
where table3.PROJECT_ID=<PROJECT_ID>  and  table3.LOGICAL_ID like '%sd.%');

delete from AO_C7F17E_LINGO where ID in (
Select table3.ID ​
FROM AO_C7F17E_LINGO as table3
where table3.PROJECT_ID=<PROJECT_ID> and table3.LOGICAL_ID like '%sd.%');{code}

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After a JCMA migration, the mentions are missing in Jira issue, it shows 'Former user' instead of the user mention.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Migrate to cloud using the JCMA using JCMA 1.5.7 or 1.6.3 (that we know of so far)

h3. Expected Results

Migration is successful and content is preserved
h3. Actual Results

Migration is successful, but mentions are not displayed. 
 Also, if we check in the database, table jiraaction and column actionbody, we will find 'Former user' instead of a regular mention entry (e.g.: [~accountid:5a17689640207c40ef90b890].
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Cloud migration assistant appears to unlocks the Flagged field in the Cloud target during migrations.
It then adds some additional contexts to the Flagged field which can prevent issues from being Flagged, it's not just not great that a locked field gets unlocked.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use JCMA to perform your migration

h3. Expected Results

Migration continues like normal
h3. Actual Results

A locked field gets unlocked
h3. Workaround

Not aware of a workaround at the moment.

 # Click *Confirm*

h3. Expected Results

The policy is approved and the message changes.
h3. Actual Results

The toast pop-up

!image-2021-10-13-15-52-45-517.png|width=256!

The message stays as
{quote}The policy you agreed to has been updated. Review changes and agree again before your app data can be migrated.
{quote}
The below exception is thrown in the {{atlassian-confluence.log}} file:

2021-10-13 15:39:58,791 ERROR [http-nio-1990-exec-7] [common.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] toResponse Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: clas
s com.atlassian.migration.app.AccessScope cannot be cast to class com.atlassian.migration.app.AccessScope (com.atlassian.migration.app.AccessScope is in unnam
ed module of loader org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl$BundleClassLoader @6356133e; com.atlassian.migration.app.AccessScope is in unnamed module of l
oader org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl$BundleClassLoader @3788b901)
 -- referer: http://localhost:1990/confluence/admin/migration.action | url: /confluence/rest/migration/latest/app/consent/update | traceId: 91794a2c009fba38 |
 userName: admin
java.lang.ClassCastException: class com.atlassian.migration.app.AccessScope cannot be cast to class com.atlassian.migration.app.AccessScope (com.atlassian.mig
ration.app.AccessScope is in unnamed module of loader org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl$BundleClassLoader @6356133e; com.atlassian.migration.app.Acc
essScope is in unnamed module of loader org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl$BundleClassLoader @3788b901)
        at java.base/java.lang.Iterable.forEach(Iterable.java:75)
        at com.atlassian.migration.agent.service.app.AppAccessScopeService.lambda$updatedAppAssessScopes$1(AppAccessScopeService.java:47)
        at com.atlassian.migration.agent.store.tx.PluginTransactionTemplate.lambda$on$0(PluginTransactionTemplate.java:10)
        at com.atlassian.migration.agent.store.jpa.impl.DefaultPluginTransactionTemplate.on(DefaultPluginTransactionTemplate.java:40)
        at com.atlassian.migration.agent.store.tx.PluginTransactionTemplate.on(PluginTransactionTemplate.java:9)
        at com.atlassian.migration.agent.store.tx.PluginTransactionTemplate.write(PluginTransactionTemplate.java:28)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using Discoverable Listener for app migration, when clicking on *Confirm* in the *Agree to app migration* step, the scopes are not saved and the *Done* button does not become clickable.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Jira Cloud Migration Assistant and an app that has an automatic migration path
 # Set the app as Needed in Cloud in the Assess your apps step
 # Install the cloud version of the app in Prepare your apps step
 # Go to Agree to app migration and click View policy
 # Click Confirm

h3. Expected Results

The *Done* button becomes clickable.
h3. Actual Results

The message stays as
{quote}The policy you agreed to has been updated. Review changes and agree again before your app data can be migrated.
{quote}
and the *Done* button is not clickable
 !agree-to-app-migration.png|height=256!
h3. Workaround

Workarounds are
 * to use [dev-mode|https://developer.atlassian.com/platform/app-migration/testing/dev-mode/] however this is not acceptable for end users.
 * change to using other app migration libraries, e.g.  {{atlassian-app-cloud-migration-tracker}}
fields.summary: Discoverable Listener does not record accepted scopes in Jira Cloud Migration Assistant

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Jira Cloud Migration Assistant, when installing an app for the first time and then going to App Assessment stage Prepare your Apps, the access scope do not display in the modal box the first time they are viewed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install JCMA and an app that has an automatic migration path
 # Set the app as *Needed in Cloud* in the *Assess your apps* step
 # Install the cloud version of the app in *Prepare your apps* step
 # Go to *Agree to app migration* and click *View policy*

h3. Expected Results

The modal displays all the scopes.
h3. Actual Results

The modal does not list any scopes.

!consent-stage.png|height=256!
h3. Workaround

Click *Confirm* on the modal and then click *View policy* again. The scopes should appear.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When there are multiple directories with the same group names, the user interface aggregates them, however when the migration assistant displays the total number of groups that will be migrated, retrieves the total number of groups from the database. Leading the customer to assume that there is some data discrepancy.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Need to have duplicate groups entries across different directories in the database, see *example* below:
||group_name||directory_id||
|internal-users|1|
|confluence-users|1|
|management|1|
|internal-users|10000|
|management|10000|
# Check groups in the user interface (only 3 would be displayed)
# Create a migration plan on CCMA

h3. Expected Results
3 groups would be displayed in the migration plan

h3. Actual Results
5 groups are displayed in the migration plan

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour, a workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Running a CSV import from the issue navigator (*Issues Navigator (...) > Import issues from CSV*) fails when there's a custom field in the CSV populated with an email address instead of AAID.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project with a user custom field
 # Create a CSV file that has a column for that custom field
 # Populate the user custom field column in the CSV file with a valid email address
 # Import the CSV file using the "Import issues from CSV feature" and map the custom field column to the correct custom field in Jira

h3. Expected Results

The file is imported, and the custom field is populated with the correct users for the new issues.
h3. Actual Results

The import fails with the error "*Pick another user as the selected user doesnât exist.* " because the users could not be found:

!image-2021-10-11-15-26-28-862.png|width=533,height=308!
h3. Workaround


 You either replace the email address with the user Account ID (AAID) and the import will work or use the External System Import feature:
 # Choose !https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/files/945104532/953138831/1/1530296096612/cog.png|height=18! > *System*.
 # In the Import and Export section, click *External System Import* and then click *CSV*.
fields.summary: Importing CSV where user fields are specified by e-mail address doesn't work

h3. Issue Summary

The bug exists in Jira Cloud Migration Assistant's export workflow function. JCMA doesn’t need to export workflowXML anymore and JMT should stop importing workflowXML.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

To be added later.
h3. Expected Results

Migration should happen without error.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
2021-10-01 17:51:32.926 ERROR XYZ project-import We couldn't import Workflow 'XY-Z Task Workflow v3'. Reason: Entity Workflow 'XY-Z Task Workflow v3' size exceeds size limit: unable to be pre-processed. Entity was skipped..

While migrating JSM project using JSM-JCMA custom JAR, certain Issues will fail during export phase, this occurs when Issue references invalid SLA data

_to be added_

Remove invalid SLA data, and migrate issue successfully

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While migrating JSM project using JSM-JCMA custom JAR, certain Request types will fail to migrate because JCMA fails in a step while validating the Request type fields.

The validation step doesn't expect null values but in certain cases they can occur. One scenario in which this error occurs is if the "Scheme scheme" related to the "Request Type" being migrated contains an invalid reference to a custom field (example: The custom field was deleted from the server instance but the scheme still holds the reference)
h3. Steps to Reproduce

_to be added_
h3. Expected Results

Request type should be extracted and exported successfully
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the JCMA error log
{noformat}
2021-XX-X9 15:33:18.044 ERROR XXX project-export We couldn't export Request Type 1. Reason: java.lang.NullPointerException: it.orderableField must not be null.
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

We have identified a workaround for this, however the fix for the same has been identified and will be patched in the next JSM-JCMA release.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While migrating JSM project using JSM-JCMA custom JAR, some times default project language settings will fail to migrate if all required translations have not been defined.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JSM project with sample data

 # Migrate with JSM-JCMA custom JAR

h3. Expected Results

NOTE: Ideal outcome is still being discussed

Notify migration admin that project language settings for respective JSM project isn't migrated or avoid migration of such project language settings.
h3. Actual Results

The below error message is observed in JCMA error log
{noformat}
2021-XX-XX 13:XX:02.415 ERROR XX project-import We couldn't import Project Language 10010. Reason: 400 Bad Request: [{"errors":[{"errorMessage":"The project default language cannot be changed to German (Germany) because it has missing or outdated translations. Make sure this language's translations are up to date and try again."}],"reasonKey":"sd.admin.languagesupport.managelanguage.error.new.default.language.flagged","reasonCode":"400"}].
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Check the project language settings for respective JSM project on the cloud site post migration.
 # Manually select the languages that are required for the project. 
 # Choose the default language. Check if there are more translations required to be added for this language (all translations must exist before selecting the default language on Cloud).
 # Change the default language to the language chosen in step 2.
fields.summary: Project language fails to import. Default language cannot be changed due to missing / outdated translations

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Short URLs or (Share URLs) point to previous site after Cloud migration

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* On the source instance, go to any page and click on *Share*
* Copy the link
* Edit a page and save the URL in the text
* Migrate to another Cloud instance 

h3. Expected Results
* URLs are updated to point to the page on the destination site

h3. Actual Results
* URLs are unique to the page

h3. Workaround

To resolve this manually, you can:
* Go to the same page on the new site
* Get the Share URL
* Edit the page with the old URL
* Replace the URL with the new one

h3. Notes

Share URL does not seem to be based on the Content ID of a page, and always redirects to the previous instance even if the domain in the URL is replaced. So this fix is different than the Tiny URL fix which we do have a bulk workaround for. 

The share URL is generated by sending a POST request to this endpoint:
* https://site.atlassian.net/gateway/api/atl-link/create

This returns something like this:
* {code:borderStyle=solid}
{"shortUrl":"https://site.atlassian.net/l/c/iKC9ewU9","fullUrl":"https://site.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/MIG/pages/1099719725/Page+Title?atlOrigin=MxYjAyYmMxNzkiLCJwIjoiYyJ9","linkId":"iKC9ewU9"}
{code}

And the URL changes on each new share.
fields.summary: Share URLs point to previous site after Cloud migration in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While migrating JSM project using JSM-JCMA custom JAR, some times automation rules (usually the ones that have been created by default) will fail while being imported in cloud destination site.

This error is observed to occur when certain configurations within the failing automation rules are invalid (either they are already invalid in the server or invalid in the cloud because certain configurations in the cloud destination site have drifted / changed).
h3. Steps to Reproduce

_to be added_
h3. Expected Results

Automation rule should be migrated successfully
h3. Actual Results

The below types of error messages are observed in JCMA error log
{noformat}
2021-09-17 18:43:25.592 ERROR XXXXXX project-import We couldn't import Automation Rules 25. Reason: 400 Bad Request: [{"errors":[{"errorMessage":"Request Validation Error : [Please select a valid action]"}],"reasonKey":"Request Validation Error : [Please select a valid action]","reasonCode":"400"}].
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

If feasible, delete the automation rule that is failing, in this way we can bypass the error during migration and subsequently re-create the respective automation rule in the cloud destination site.
fields.summary: Automation rule import fails - with message containing "Please select a valid action..."

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The CSV importer is unable to map the user's to the comment when the email of the user is provided in the comment column of the CSV file.  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new CSV file with the comment field containing the email of the author
 # Import the file in the Jira Cloud

h3. Expected Results

The importer maps the email of the user to the required user in the site.
h3. Actual Results

The importer is unable to find the user and maps the comment to the logged-in user instead.
 !Screenshot 2020-02-03 at 4.09.21 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Use the username or the Atlassian account id of the user to map the author of the comment.
fields.summary: CSV importer unable to map user when comment column has author's email

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Custom field date picker value will be different value(one day ahead) when migrating with Site Import

h3. Steps to Reproduce

JSW Server Environment: system timezone=Asia/Tokyo

1.Export XML Site Backup in Jira Server. 
2.Add new Jira Software site to existing organization
3.Import XML Site Backup to Jira Cloud.
4.After import to Jira Cloud, the custom field date picker value is different value(one day ahead) from Server one.

Note: When importing XML Site Backup to new Jira Software site with new organization, this bug doesn't happen.

h3. Expected Results

Custom field date picker value will be migrated in actual date value.

h3. Actual Results

Custom field date picker value will be one day ahead

h3. Workaround

h4. Workaround 1: create the new JSW site with new organization

- Create new Jira Software site with new organization
-- URL: https://www.atlassian.com/ja/software/jira/free

h4. Workaround 2: make new XML Site Import file in Jira Cloud

- use Workaround 1 and success migration in Jira Cloud
- Make new XML Site Import file from Jira Cloud
- Use the new XML Site Import file
fields.summary: Custom field date picker value will be different value(one day ahead) when migrating with XML Site Import to existing organization

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using {{atlassian-app-cloud-migration-listener}} at the end of App Assessment and the app is set as Needed in Cloud, when the endpoint {{/rest/migration/latest/app/consent}} is called, a 500 error is thrown and this toast appears

!image-2021-09-30-13-44-53-919.png!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install an app that used {{atlassian-app-cloud-migration-listener}}
 # Go though App Assessment to the end

h3. Expected Results

We get the expected display of the app.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the {{atlassian-confluence.log}} file:
{noformat}
2021-09-30 13:33:54,312 ERROR [http-nio-1990-exec-4] [[Standalone].[localhost].[/confluence].[noop]] log Servlet.service() for servlet [noop] in context with 
path [/confluence] threw exception
org.codehaus.jackson.map.JsonMappingException: (was java.lang.NullPointerException) (through reference chain: com.atlassian.migration.agent.dto.assessment.App
ListResponse["apps"]->java.util.ArrayList[1]->com.atlassian.migration.agent.dto.assessment.AppConsentDto["dataScopes"]->java.util.ArrayList[0])
...
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
{noformat}
and the UI throws
!image-2021-09-30-13-44-53-919.png!
h3. Workaround

For now, developers can use [https://developer.atlassian.com/platform/app-migration/testing/dev-mode/|https://developer.atlassian.com/platform/app-migration/testing/dev-mode/] to by pass App Assessment until this is resolved.
fields.summary: Using DiscoverableListener in Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant causes a NullPointerException during app assessment

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently if you load in a site import file, there is nothing stopping an admin from navigating away from the page and then returning to trigger another file because the page does not display the progress of any validation task already in progress. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to *Restore* from Jira Cloud Administration
# Load in a large test file
# Close the page or navigate to another page
# Return to Restore

h3. Expected Results
The UI should show that a validation has already been kicked off. 

h3. Actual Results
The UI doesn't show any indication that a validation task has already been kicked off for an import. Since the admin doesn't have any indication of progress, it seems reasonable that one could assume they need to restart it. If they do, they will eventually return a DEAD status for the validation portion and need to start all over again. 

The below exception is thrown in backend logs: 
{noformat}
Zombie task 920326 detected in state DEAD while updating the progress
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
The short term workaround is ask the customers to make sure they follow to upload one file at a time and wait until it finishes.
fields.summary: Jira Site Import Allows the End User to Trigger more than one validation task which results in DEAD status

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Core data in a Confluence migration may have page restrictions which isn't accessible by REST endpoints. As a result Connect apps cannot update their data such as macros or custom content.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install an app in server that uses custom content
 # Add macro or content to a page and restrict the page
 # Migrate the data
 # In Cloud, use the REST endpoint to update the macro or custom content

h3. Expected Results
Content can be updated by the app

h3. Actual Results
The app receives a HTTP 403

h3. Workaround
Connect apps can use admin impersonation, but an admin needs to be specified and this may also generate a page edit.
fields.summary: Apps can't access restricted content in Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

This error occurs during JSM migrations via JCMA. If an issue references a Request type that exists in the server instance but is no longer associated with the project being migrated.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

WIP - Team is identifying how to re-create this scenario
h3. Expected Results

Issue should migrate and shouldn't reference to the "Request Type" (since it no longer belongs to the project being migrated)
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the JCMA error log file:
{noformat}
Exporting entity Issue XX-24X4XX failed kotlin.NotImplementedError: Exporter for 7 does not support extracting by ID

We have patched this fix in JSM-JCMA custom JAR *v29*, this version hasn't been shared to all via the EAP dropbox link.

If you're blocked due to this export issue only, then reach out to the support team and use *v29* for the interim period.
fields.summary: Issue export fails due to kotlin.NotImplementedError

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to open Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant versions 3.2.4 and 3.2.5 running a MSSQL database, it throws the following error stack:
{code:java}
Cause

org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getInitialState' in class com.atlassian.migration.agent.web.AppAction threw exception com.atlassian.util.concurrent.LazyReference$InitializationException: org.hibernate.exception.GenericJDBCException: Error accessing table metadata at /templates/app.vm[line 21, column 44]
at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTIdentifier.execute(ASTIdentifier.java:223)

caused by: com.atlassian.util.concurrent.LazyReference$InitializationException: org.hibernate.exception.GenericJDBCException: Error accessing table metadata
at com.atlassian.util.concurrent.LazyReference.getInterruptibly(LazyReference.java:149)

caused by: org.hibernate.exception.GenericJDBCException: Error accessing table metadata
at org.hibernate.exception.internal.StandardSQLExceptionConverter.convert(StandardSQLExceptionConverter.java:47)

caused by: java.sql.SQLException: The database name component of the object qualifier must be the name of the current database.
at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.SQLDiagnostic.addDiagnostic(SQLDiagnostic.java:372)
{code}
Users who have followed below document and confirmed that the DB name is the same as in SQL still run into the same problem:

["The component of the database name of the object qualifier must be the name of the current database" error on upgrade to Confluence 6.1+|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/the-component-of-the-database-name-of-the-object-qualifier-must-be-the-name-of-the-current-database-error-on-upgrade-to-confluence-6-1+-902076143.html]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant 3.2.4 or higher on a Confluence running MSSQL.
 # Open Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant
 # It will throw the error above.

h3. Expected Results

Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant should be running.
h3. Actual Results

Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant errors out and cannot be executed.
h3. Workaround

Revert back to Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant 3.2.3:
 # Uninstall previous version of Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant.
 # Go to {{<confluence-base-url>/admin/darkfeatures.action}}
 # Add the following dark feature:
 {{migration-assistant.disable.app-outdated-check}}
 # Download the Jar file for version 3.2.3 on your workstation by browsing to the following URL:
{code:java}
https://marketplace.atlassian.com/download/apps/1219672/version/300100311
{code}

 # Navigate to *General Configuration* > *Manage apps*
 # Choose *Upload app*
 # Locate the file then click *Upload*
 # Try to migrate again using Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant
fields.summary: Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant versions 3.2.4 and 3.2.5 are not running on MSSQL database

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When running Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant after upgrade, an exception will be thrown when running a migration.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install a version of Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant lower than 3.2.5
 # Prepare a plan with Users and Groups
 # Upgrade Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant to version 3.2.5
 # Run a migration

h3. Expected Results

The migration succeeds and no errors are thrown in the logs.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the {{atlassian-confluence.log}} file:
{noformat}
org.hibernate.PropertyAccessException: Null value was assigned to a property [class com.atlassian.migration.agent.entity.MigrateUsersTask.scoped] of primitive type setter of com.atlassian.migration.agent.entity.MigrateUsersTask.scoped
2[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at 
...
com.atlassian.migration.agent.service.impl.DefaultPlanService.getMigrateAppsTask(DefaultPlanService.java:100)
32[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.migration.agent.service.catalogue.PlatformService.getProgress(PlatformService.java:181)
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Update the database to provide a default value for the scoped value for Migrate Users task with
{code:java}
update mig_task set scoped = true where tasktype = 'USERS' AND scoped is null;{code}
If you're on Oracle try (capitalisation may be required for table and column name
{code:java}
update mig_task set scoped = 1 where tasktype = 'USERS' AND scoped is null;{code}
fields.summary: Running a migration causes an IllegalArgumentException on MigrateUsersTask.scoped

Project data progress is 100%

fields.description: Customers should be able to re-run app migrations should they return failed or incomplete statuses without having to create a new migration plan or contact the Marketplace Partner for support. A re-run would allow a customer to resolve issues manually post migration and re-try migrating app data.
fields.summary: Re-run app migrations

fields.description:
Currently CCMA checks for the updated version each time before a migration plan is ran. In order to bypass this check, the admin has to make a configuration change via a dark feature so that this check doesn't fail and prohibit the admin from running a plan.

Since many customers would not want to change the plugin version they are testing, especially right before a migration, it seems practical to provide them an option to self service this.
fields.summary: Provide a mechanism for admins to bypass the upgrade CCMA version check

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The issue *Created*, *Updated,* or *Assigned* Events are not triggering when issues are created/updated from CSV using External System Import, hence no notifications are sent.

It was tested updating the assignee and creating new issues using CSV External System Import.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Import issue using CSV External System Import.
 # Map the issue's summary and assignee ID (and key).
 # Create/update the issue.

h3. Expected Results

According to the project's notification scheme, the assignee should be notified of the new issue assigned/updated/created.
h3. Actual Results

No notification is triggered. No logs were found.
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround

 Reassigning the issue manually will trigger the notification.
fields.summary: Issue import using CSV External System Import does not trigger notifications

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While migrating JSM project using JSM-JCMA custom JAR, "Change group" associated with Issues fail to export.

This usually occurs when
 # Issue at some point was dis-associated from a "Request Type"
 # Issue is referencing a "Customer Organisation" that isn't associated with the project being migrated

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

WIP
h3. Expected Results

Change group should be exported
h3. Actual Results

The below types of exceptions is thrown in the JCMA error log file:
{noformat}
2021-09-19 11:40:31.369 ERROR DESK project-export We couldn't export Change Group 963XXX (on Issue XXXX-19). Reason: java.lang.NullPointerException: fieldData.changeItem.to must not be null.
{noformat}
{code:java}
2021-XX-XX XX:59:56.437066 ERROR XXXX project-export We couldn't export Change Group 43703 (on Issue XXX-255). Reason: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Entity mri:mig:jira/servicedesk:customerOrganization:4 is expected to be exported, but it was not.
{code}
h3. Workaround

-We have patched this fix in JSM-JCMA custom JAR *v28*, this version hasn't been shared to all via the EAP dropbox link. This will soon be done.-

-If you're blocked due to this export issue only, then reach out to internal teams and use *v28* for the interim period.-

The next release of JSM-JCMA custom JAR will have the fix for such issues. The release is expected to be made around mid Oct'21
fields.summary: Change Group failed to export
