fields.description:
Upon implementing {{CloudMigrationListenerV1}}, issue {{issueLinkManager}} to migrate issue links from Server/DC to Cloud will sometimes generate mismatching issue links.

A possible way to make this work, specifically, is to pre-convert issue IDs to issue keys instead.

An improvement for JCMA would be to ensure consistency between Server/Cloud issue link mappings.
fields.summary: JCMA Issue Links are intermittently restored incorrectly during Server to Cloud migration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A customer created a migration plan from JCMA. The version of the app is the latest one. However, during the validation checks, it could not connect to the cloud for user count limit check (as the token had expired) and the error screen show a *Last Updated* date of "52 years ago".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Start a JCMA migration plan
- Wait for token expiry interval
- Try and continue the plan from where it was left off

h3. Expected Results
The correct expiration date of the token is shown and/or user asked to re-select the destination cloud site.

h3. Actual Results
Customer see the last updated date as decades ago. (See actual customer screenshot in an internal comment)

h3. Workaround

Re-selecting the target cloud site refreshes the token and the message goes away.
fields.summary: JCMA reports a last update date decades in the past on cloud token expiry

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When importing issues via CSV, it is possible to create new components and update the same in the issues

Example CSV file:
{code:java}
Summary, Components, Components
Test, Component1, Component2{code}

Once CSV file is imported, we see the UI message that project/issues were created (see attached snippet)

Though we see the warning-related component lead, the components are created in the project (without component lead) and updated in the project issues.

h3. Suggestion

It would be great to improve the messaging to notify that components were also created in the project along with the issues.
fields.summary: Improve UI messaging when importing components via CSV import

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Apps that have only a Data Center and Cloud listing in Marketplace do not appear correctly in App Assessment for Exists in Cloud and Can Be Migrated columns, even if the data is correct in Marketplace. 

Here we can see the app app.jxl has an entry in Maketplace for the {{/migration}} endpoint.
{code:java}
$ curl --silent 'https://marketplace.atlassian.com/rest/2/addons/app.jxl/migration' | jq '.'
{
  "vendorId": 1219648,
  "addonKey": "app.jxl",
  "addonName": "JXL - Spreadsheet Table Issue Editor for Jira",
  "cloudAddonKey": "app.jxl",
  "cloudVersionAvailability": "PUBLIC",
  "cloudVersionDevelopmentRoadmap": "https://jxl.app/docs/roadmap",
  "featureDifferenceDocumentation": "https://jxl.app/help/migration/features",
  "migrationDocumentation": "https://jxl.app/help/migration/paths",
  "cloudMigrationAssistantCompatibility": "1.0.0"
}
{code}
We can confirm the versions available with
{code:java}
$ curl --silent 'https://marketplace.atlassian.com/rest/2/addons/app.jxl?application=jira&hosting=datacenter&withVersion=true' | jq '._embedded.version.deployment'
{
  "server": false,
  "cloud": false,
  "connect": false,
  "autoUpdateAllowed": false,
  "permissions": [],
  "dataCenter": true,
  "dataCenterStatus": "compatible"
} {code}
However in the Cloud Migration Assistants, they only uses {{hosting=server}}, and doesn't check the {{datacenter}} value for {{hosting}} when aggregating the marketplace data. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Marketplace have an app that only has DataCenter and Cloud entries
 # Install the app in a Data Center instance of Jira or Confluence
 # Go to App Assessment in the relevant CMA and check the values for *Exists in cloud* and *Can be migrated*

h3. Expected Results

*Exists in cloud* and *Can be migrated* are correctly populated based on the information in [https://developer.atlassian.com/platform/app-migration/app-assessment-UI/] .
h3. Actual Results

*Exists in cloud* and *Can be migrated* show as (x).

!image-2021-09-15-11-56-12-876.png|width=541,height=218!
h3. Workaround

Ensure you app has an entry for server in Marketplace.
fields.summary: Apps with only Data Center and Cloud versions do not appear with correct data in App Assessment

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Renaming Epic issue type in next-gen projects breaks the import CSV function of normal tasks when mapping the issue key

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a team-managed project rename the Epic issue type
 # try to import the CSV file via import from external system
 # Select summary and issue key
 # Jira will not you import any issues unless the stories have a parent Epic.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 # rename back the issue type to Epic and Epic to one issue
 # importing CSV file will clear the Parent of all the imported stories!!
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Jira should allow you to import stories without parents when you rename the Epic.

h3. Actual Results
Renaming Epic issue type breaks the import of issues via CSV file
Here is the video
https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/410391/demo_parent_issue.mp4

h3. Workaround

Imports that don't map the issue key continue to work. 
Importing csv via the Advanced Search screen continues to work
fields.summary: renaming Epic on next-gen projects breaks the CSV import from external system when mapping issueKey

fields.description:
The App migration platform team provided 2 buk APIs that can only be usedby apps in the migration context:
 * Custom fields bulk API: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/MIG-311
 * Entity properties bulk API: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/MIG-312

These APIs requires apps to impersonate an admin user in order to consume it. That impersonation is not required for single operation APIs. Removing that requirement would greatly ease migration path development.
h2. Workaround

For now, developers can use 
 * [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-groups/#api-rest-api-3-group-member-get]

to retrieve Jira users in an admin group, and then they need to pass the site admin AAID in the header
 * {{Atlassian-Account-Id}}

to use the Bulk API.
fields.summary: Remove  admin user impersonation from bulk APIs requirements

fields.description: The Bitbucket Cloud Migration Assistant does not migrate app data. Some Bitbucket apps do not require data migration; others will need additional support from the Marketplace Partner who developed and maintains the app.
fields.summary: Bitbucket Cloud Migration Assistant does not migrate app data

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JCMA does not update custom field names in migrated filters

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Cloud have a custom field of one type, radio buttons for example
 # On Server have a custom field with same name but is a different type, select list for example
 # On Server create board for project being migrated. Edit filter's JQL to include custom field name somehow
 # Migrate project containing that custom field from Server to Cloud with JCMA

h3. Expected Results

New custom field created with (Migrated) appended to custom field name to address conflicts
Migrated JQL filters are updated with (Migrated) appended to custom field names so they continue to function after migration

h3. Actual Results

New custom field created with (Migrated) appended to custom field name to address conflicts
Migrated JQL filters are not updated and are potentially broken

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: JCMA does not update custom field names in migrated filters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When we delete a user in Jira, if the user is added to a custom field +User Picker (multiple users)+, the reference in the custom field is not removed. Then when a JCMA migration is executed the following error is thrown and the migration fails:
{noformat}2021-09-03 15:35:57.716 ERROR <pkey> project-import We couldn't import Custom Field Default Value 'Default Configuration Scheme for <Custom-field-name>' because of 1 missing dependencies: User '<username>'. Check the reasons for the missing dependencies on your server site.{noformat}

If we check the cwd_user table, the user is no longer there, but then navigating to the custom field configuration, it is possible to find the user reference.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a user to a custom field type +User Picker (multiple users)+
# Delete this user
# Run a JCMA migration with a project that has this custom field

h3. Expected Results
Migration will be completed

h3. Actual Results
Migration fails with the error:
{noformat}2021-09-03 15:35:57.716 ERROR <pkey> project-import We couldn't import Custom Field Default Value 'Default Configuration Scheme for <Custom-field-name>' because of 1 missing dependencies: User '<username>'. Check the reasons for the missing dependencies on your server site.{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Navigate to the custom fields screen and select the option "Configure" for this custom field. Find the user that appears in the error and remove the user reference. Once it is done, retry the JCMA migration.
fields.summary: JCMA migration fails due to a orphan user reference in the custom field type User Picker (multiple users)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* After migrating of JSM via Site Import from Server to Cloud, the JSM Agent faces a problem with JSM settings showing "Snap, you cannot view this page". 
* In the “Email Request” settings, we get a spinning loop.
* The user affected by the problem has JSM Agent Permission for the project.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Export backup from Jira Server (which has JSM).
# Perform Site Import of the backup to Jira Cloud.

h3. Expected Results
* No "Snap, you cannot view this page" or infinite spinning loop problems on JSM Project Settings options.

h3. Actual Results
* Migrated projects are affected by the problem.
* Newly created projects post migrations is unaffected by the problem.

*Root Cause*
* The problem happens because the source data from Jira Server may have been corrupted.
* One way of source data corruption is caused when the the backup is generated from a staging server *and the staging server hit into OOM Java Heap problems* during production data refresh.
** In some cases (eg: to workaround limitation with site import that does not allow external directory users), we may use staging instance to perform database updates to user tables prior to generating a backup. It is during XML restoration of Production Server to Staging Server where OOM happens.
* We can see the following during XML restore to Staging Server:
{code}
2021-06-06 01:46:08,775 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 ERROR jira.admin 98x63x1 y1g6py 172.17.0.1 /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [c.a.j.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService] Error importing data: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
	at java.util.Arrays.copyOf(Arrays.java:3236)
	at java.lang.StringCoding.safeTrim(StringCoding.java:79)
	at java.lang.StringCoding.encode(StringCoding.java:365)
	at java.lang.String.getBytes(String.java:941)
	at org.postgresql.core.Utils.encodeUTF8(Utils.java:53)
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.SimpleParameterList.getV3Length(SimpleParameterList.java:339)
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.sendBind(QueryExecutorImpl.java:1449)
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.sendOneQuery(QueryExecutorImpl.java:1767)
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.sendQuery(QueryExecutorImpl.java:1294)
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.execute(QueryExecutorImpl.java:446)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc.PgStatement.executeBatch(PgStatement.java:793)
...
...
2021-06-06 02:11:21,921 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 ERROR jira.admin 122x828x1 y1g6py 172.17.0.1 /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [c.a.j.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService] Error importing data: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
	at java.lang.StringCoding.encode(StringCoding.java:350)
	at java.lang.String.getBytes(String.java:941)
	at org.postgresql.core.Utils.encodeUTF8(Utils.java:53)
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.SimpleParameterList.getV3Length(SimpleParameterList.java:339)
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.sendBind(QueryExecutorImpl.java:1449)
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.sendOneQuery(QueryExecutorImpl.java:1767)
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.sendQuery(QueryExecutorImpl.java:1294)
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.execute(QueryExecutorImpl.java:446)
{code}
* Although there are Java Heap Space problems during restoration, users are able to login and generate another backup. But from here, the data is already corrupted.
* Subsequent Site Import to Cloud with this corrupted data will not hit into an error during Site Import process.

h3. Workaround / Resolution
* We can avoid Java Heap Space problems during restoration to Staging Server by using a JVM Heap value that is bigger than {{activeobjects.xml}} size. Eg: {{activeobjects.xml}} is 5GB in size, JVM max heap should be ~6GB.
* This will avoid the data corruption.
fields.summary: "Snap, you cannot view this page" / infinite spinning on JSM settings options post Site Import from Server to Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While using the JSM-JCMA plugin to migrate JSM project, issue will fail to export if the issue has stale reference to "organizations".
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add an organization to a Service Desk issue within a project.
 # Create an issue within the JSM project. In the organization field, put the organization created in (1).
 # Remove organization created in (1) from project following steps from [https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/remove-an-organization-from-a-service-project/].
 # Perform JCMA migration of JSM project.

h3. Expected Results

Project will successfully be migrated to Cloud.
h3. Actual Results
 * Migration will fail with the below error:
{code:java}
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Export of data of project XXXX failed, please check export log for more details.
{code}
!image-2021-09-09-23-32-59-293.png|thumbnail! 
 The below exception is thrown in the migration logs file:
{code:java}
2021-09-09 13:25:44.800451 ERROR JSMB project-export We couldn't export Issue JSMB-2. Reason: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Entity mri:mig:jira/servicedesk:customerOrganization:1 is expected to be exported, but it was not.
{code}

h3. Solution

Re-migrate with JCMA custom JAR *v27* from dropbox link shared in JSM EAP program
h3. -Workaround-
 * -Identify the affected issue by checking on the Jira Issues listed in the log. In the example above, the Jira issue that failed is JSMB-2.-
 * -Identify the organization that failed by referring to the ID. In the example above, the organization ID is 1. If there are multiple organization on the issue, we can check from the DB tables.-
{code:java}
~~select * from "AO_54307E_ORGANIZATION";~~
{code}

 * -Remove the stale reference from Jira Issue and retry migration.-
fields.summary: Issue fails to export because of stale reference to organization in JSM project.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
CSV import does not add user value to User Picker custom fields when the user's email address is used for Team-managed projects

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field of User Picker (People) type in a Team-managed project
 # Generate a CSV that will fill in that custom field with a user's email address
 # Import the CSV accordingly
 # Notice that the issue created or edited remains with no value in the custom field and the importer fails to add the value silently.

h3. Expected Results
User value should be inserted or at least an error message should be included in the importer log.

h3. Actual Results
User value remains empty and no messages are displayed anywhere.

h3. Workaround
Gather the respective users' Atlassian account ID and replace the email addresses of the CSV file by their IDs before importing the CSV file.
fields.summary: CSV import does not add user value to User Picker custom fields when the user's email address is used for Team-managed projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you have a custom field named as *Status*, the external system import will point to that field instead of the system one even if you select the issue field one during the field mapping step.

Here's a recording:  [^CSV import behaviour.mp4] 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Create a custom field named as *Status*
* Start a CSV import on the external system import
* Select the Issue field Status during the columns -> fields mapping step

h3. Expected Results

The importer will present you the options to select the target status:
 !Screen Shot 2021-09-01 at 13.52.35.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

Even though you have selected the correct field on the previous step, the importer will point to the custom field.

h3. Workaround

Temporarily rename the custom field to something else before importing the CSV file.
fields.summary: External system imports points to wrong Status field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
During the import process, Jira will collect data and create inserts into the table *invertedfieldscope* and this task might fail randomly with a timeout

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Get a backup file from Jira Server
 # Start import of the XML backup file into a cloud site

h3. Expected Results
The import should be able to insert the data into the table without reaching any timeouts

h3. Actual Results
The import fails with this message at the UI:
{code:java}
jira-import timed out: HEARTBEAT 
{code}
The below exception is thrown in the Jira flogs:
{code:java}
 msg: This connection has been closed.
     stack: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: This connection has been closed.
	at org.postgresql.jdbc.PgConnection.checkClosed(PgConnection.java:865)
***
   message: Unable to rollback SQL connection.
{code}
{code:java}
     msg: Retrying inverted fieldscope generation for project 14336 failed
     stack: java.lang.RuntimeException: Retrying inverted fieldscope generation for project 14336 failed
	at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.tasks.adhoc.fieldscope.InvertedFieldscopeGenerationQueryDslHelper.lambda$null$4(InvertedFieldscopeGenerationQueryDslHelper.java:93)
***
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
Caused by: com.querydsl.core.QueryException: Caught PSQLException for insert into "public"."invertedfieldscope" ("project_id", "issue_type_id", "field_id", "in_scope")
select "PROJECT"."id", "issuetypeoptionconfiguration"."optionid", "FIELD_LAYOUT_ITEM"."fieldidentifier", true
from "public"."project" "PROJECT"
left join "public"."configurationcontext" "issuetypeconfigurationcontext"
on "PROJECT"."id" = "issuetypeconfigurationcontext"."project" and "issuetypeconfigurationcontext"."customfield" = ?
inner join "public"."fieldconfigschemeissuetype" "issuetypefieldconfigschemeissuetype"
on "issuetypeconfigurationcontext"."fieldconfigscheme" = "issuetypefieldconfigschemeissuetype"."fieldconfigscheme" or "issuetypeconfigurationcontext"."fieldconfigscheme" is null and "issuetypefieldconfigschemeissuetype"."fieldconfigscheme" = ?
inner join "public"."optionconfiguration" "issuetypeoptionconfiguration"
on "issuetypeoptionconfiguration"."fieldconfig" = "issuetypefieldconfigschemeissuetype"."fieldconfiguration"
left join "public"."fieldlayoutschemeentity" "FIELD_LAYOUT_SCHEME_ENTITY"
on "FIELD_LAYOUT_SCHEME_ENTITY"."id" = coalesce((select max("FIELD_LAYOUT_SCHEME_ENTITY"."id")
from "public"."fieldlayoutschemeentity" "FIELD_LAYOUT_SCHEME_ENTITY"
where "FIELD_LAYOUT_SCHEME_ENTITY"."scheme" = "PROJECT"."fieldlayoutscheme" and "FIELD_LAYOUT_SCHEME_ENTITY"."issuetype" = "issuetypeoptionconfiguration"."optionid"), (select max("FIELD_LAYOUT_SCHEME_ENTITY"."id")
from "public"."fieldlayoutschemeentity" "FIELD_LAYOUT_SCHEME_ENTITY"
where "FIELD_LAYOUT_SCHEME_ENTITY"."scheme" = "PROJECT"."fieldlayoutscheme" and "FIELD_LAYOUT_SCHEME_ENTITY"."issuetype" is null))
inner join "public"."fieldlayout" "FIELD_LAYOUT"
on "FIELD_LAYOUT_SCHEME_ENTITY"."fieldlayout" = "FIELD_LAYOUT"."id" or "FIELD_LAYOUT"."layout_type" = ? and "FIELD_LAYOUT_SCHEME_ENTITY"."fieldlayout" is null
inner join "public"."fieldlayoutitem" "FIELD_LAYOUT_ITEM"
on "FIELD_LAYOUT_ITEM"."fieldlayout" = "FIELD_LAYOUT"."id"
left join "public"."fieldconfigscheme" "customfieldconfigscheme"
on "customfieldconfigscheme"."id" = coalesce((select max("CONFIGURATION_CONTEXT"."fieldconfigscheme")
from "public"."configurationcontext" "CONFIGURATION_CONTEXT"
where "CONFIGURATION_CONTEXT"."customfield" != ? and "CONFIGURATION_CONTEXT"."customfield" = "FIELD_LAYOUT_ITEM"."fieldidentifier" and "CONFIGURATION_CONTEXT"."project" = "PROJECT"."id"), (select max("CONFIGURATION_CONTEXT"."fieldconfigscheme")
from "public"."configurationcontext" "CONFIGURATION_CONTEXT"
where "CONFIGURATION_CONTEXT"."customfield" != ? and "CONFIGURATION_CONTEXT"."customfield" = "FIELD_LAYOUT_ITEM"."fieldidentifier" and "CONFIGURATION_CONTEXT"."project" is null))
left join "public"."fieldconfiguration" "customfieldconfiguration"

fields.summary: Site import using XML backup fails while inserting into invertedfieldscope

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Depending on the way the backup is compressed to a zip file, import validation will fail.
e.g. Backup is generated from a MacOS with the option to compress the files, hidden system files (.DS_Store)

This error also happens if the user compress the folder instead of only the backup files (activeobjects.xml + entities.xml)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Generate a backup
# Import to cloud

h3. Expected Results
Validation take completes and the user is able to start the Jira import

h3. Actual Results
Error: "Import validation failed: The import archive doesn't contain entities.xml file"

h3. Workaround
Zip the backup (entities.xml + activeobjects.xml) using a method that doesn't add hidden files (through MacOS terminal or using some other apps, such as Keka)
fields.summary: Jira Import validation fails due to no-existing entities.xml file

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Restore from Jira Server backup failing if source server instance has a duplicate issue. e.g: two issues with the same issue-key (ABC-123 appears twice in the database)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Generate a backup from server
 # Import the backup to cloud

h3. Expected Results

Import is successful
h3. Actual Results

Migration fails

The below exception is thrown in the migration logs:
{noformat}
 msg: Duplicate key com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.persistence.CachingCustomFieldValuePersister$IssueIdAndFieldIdCacheKey@caa9d
     stack: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Duplicate key com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.persistence.CachingCustomFieldValuePersister$IssueIdAndFieldIdCacheKey@caa9d
	at java.util.stream.Collectors.lambda$throwingMerger$0(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.HashMap.merge(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.stream.Collectors.lambda$toMap$58(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.stream.ReduceOps$3ReducingSink.accept(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.ArrayList$ArrayListSpliterator.forEachRemaining(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.copyInto(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.wrapAndCopyInto(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.stream.ReduceOps$ReduceOp.evaluateSequential(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.evaluate(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline.collect(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.persistence.CachingCustomFieldValuePersister.lambda$loadCustomFieldValuesByCacheKey$17(CachingCustomFieldValuePersister.java:417)
	at java.util.HashMap$KeySet.forEach(Unknown Source)..
{noformat}
h3. Workaround
 # Identify the duplicate issues in the database, here is a PostgreSQL query to do that:
{code:sql}
select count(ji.id), p.pkey, ji.issuenum
from jiraissue ji join project p on ji.project = p.id 
group by p.pkey, ji.issuenum  HAVING count(ji.id) > 1;{code}

 # Delete the duplicate issues
 # Generate a new backup for the migration

If you have trouble to proceed with the workaround, raise a ticket with the migration support team.
fields.summary: Restore from Jira Server backup failing if server instance has duplicate issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using some of the Connect REST endpoints for app migrations, e.g.  [Mapping API - Get mappings in pages|https://developer.atlassian.com/platform/app-migration/rest/api-group-mapping-api/#api-mapping-transferid-page-get] a HTTP 400 can be returned if the {{lastEntity}} query parameter is not completely encoded.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run a Jira migration with a migratable entity with a name like {{Invalid [ | ]}} and with several more entries of similar names with invalid characters
 # From Connect, make the request
{code:java}
GET /rest/atlassian-connect/1/migration/mapping/{transferId}/page?namespace={namespace}&pageSize=1
{code}

 # Make the request again using the returned data with {{lastEntity}}
{code:java}
GET /rest/atlassian-connect/1/migration/mapping/{transferId}/page?namespace={namespace}&pageSize=1&lastEntity=Invalid+[+|+]
{code}

h3. Expected Results

Returns are returned
h3. Actual Results

A HTTP 400 result
h3. Workaround

Ensure {{lastEntity}} is completely URL encoded.
fields.summary: Calling a GET REST endpoint for app migrations with some characters is returning HTTP 400 error
